definition: abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Journalists are like dogs, when ever anything moves they begin to bark.
sentences.chinese: 新闻记者像狗，一有风吹草动，就开始叫。

sentences.english: For seven years, I was a political correspondent on this newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 我在这个报社任政治新闻记者已经七年了。

sentences.english: As a journalist of a famous journal, he journeyed frequently.
sentences.chinese: 作为一家知名期刊的新闻记者，他常常旅行。

sentences.english: The reporter interviewed the old man and checked out his family history.
sentences.chinese: 新闻记者采访了那位老人，核查了他的家史。

sentences.english: Being an anchorman or newsman is a lot like being a pilot.
sentences.chinese: 新闻主持或新闻记者很大程度上相似于一个驾驶员。

sentences.english: As soon as the President finished his talk, the reporters began firing away with questions.
sentences.chinese: 总统一讲完话，新闻记者便开始了一连串的发问。

sentences.english: America 's journalists can be a little prudish.
sentences.chinese: 美国的新闻记者可能会有些古板。

sentences.english: In these nations, journalists’ rights often depend upon fulfillment of responsibilities.
sentences.chinese: 在这些国家，新闻记者的权利往往体现为履行职责。

sentences.english: The author is an Emmy Award-winning TV former news correspondent.
sentences.chinese: 作者是获得过艾美奖的前新闻记者。

sentences.english: The news must be made by journalists.
sentences.chinese: 新闻记者现在简直象潮水似地涌来。

sentences.english: Journalists who were tipped off about the incident raced to the scene.
sentences.chinese: 事先听到有关此事风声的新闻记者争先恐后赶赴现场。

sentences.english: In the car, the journalist began to think what caused Pete to be a criminal.
sentences.chinese: 在车里，新闻记者开始思索是什么导致彼特成为罪犯。

sentences.english: At least a dozen of the victims were local journalists.
sentences.chinese: 至少有十二名遇难者是当地的新闻记者。

sentences.english: As a journalist, one must be experienced and knowledgeable.
sentences.chinese: 作为一名新闻记者，必须博学多闻。

sentences.english: Journalists must serve as an independent monitor of power.
sentences.chinese: 我在旅馆登记薄上以新闻记者的身份登了记。

sentences.english: Several journalists were found to be hand and glove with enemy agents.
sentences.chinese: 有几位新闻记者被查出与敌特勾结。

definition: Lawcourt evening news, offshoot of 北京年青报 specialising in legal news, www.fawan.com
Legal Daily, newspaper published by PRC Ministry of Justice
red star/five pointed star as symbol or communism or proletariat/hot film star
Hongxing district of Yichun city 伊春市[Yi1 chun1 shi4], Heilongjiang
Newsweek magazine/also written 新聞周刊|新闻周刊
evening newspaper/(in a newspaper's name) Evening News
